content.text: I'll help you update the time_card_entry schema to add the two new fields. Let me start by reading the current schema to understand the existing structure.

content.content:
============================================================
Name: time_card_entry
ORM: src/sdk/database/orm/orm_time_card_entry.ts
Description: Records a specific work shift entry with clock-in and clock-out times.

Fields (10):
  - id: string
    Unique identifier for the time card entry (UUID).
  - data_creator: string
    id of the user who creates the record
  - data_updater: string
    id of the user who updates the record
  - create_time: string [format: timestamp]
    create time in timestamp unix
  - update_time: string [format: timestamp]
    update time in timestamp unix
  - user_id: string
    ID of the user this time card belongs to.
  - clock_in_timestamp: string [format: timestamp]
    Timestamp when the shift started.
  - clock_out_timestamp: string (nullable) [format: timestamp]
    Timestamp when the shift ended. Null implies an active shift.
  - total_hours: number (nullable)
    Calculated duration of the shift in hours.
  - notes: string (nullable)
    Optional text notes regarding the shift.

Indexes (7):
  [1] id (primary, unique)
  [2] data_creator
  [3] data_updater
  [4] user_id
  [5] clock_in_timestamp (ordered)
  [6] clock_in_timestamp, user_id (ordered)
  [7] clock_out_timestamp


============================================================
Name: user
ORM: src/sdk/database/orm/orm_user.ts
Description: Represents a user in the system, either an Employee or a Manager.

Fields (8):
  - id: string
    Unique identifier for the user (UUID).
  - data_creator: string
    id of the user who creates the record
  - data_updater: string
    id of the user who updates the record
  - create_time: string [format: timestamp]
    create time in timestamp unix
  - update_time: string [format: timestamp]
    update time in timestamp unix
  - name: string
    Full name of the user.
  - email: string [format: email]
    Email address of the user.
  - role: enumeration
    Role of the user in the system.

Indexes (4):
  [1] id (primary, unique)
  [2] data_creator
  [3] data_updater
  [4] email (unique)

content.text: Perfect! I can see the current time_card_entry schema. Now I'll generate an updated schema that adds the two new optional fields: location and work_description.

input.command: echo '{"description": "Update time_card_entry table to add location and work_description fields. The table records work shift entries with clock-in and clock-out times. Keep all existing fields: id (UUID), data_creator, data_updater, create_time, update_time (system fields), user_id (foreign key to user), clock_in_timestamp, clock_out_timestamp (nullable), total_hours (nullable), notes (nullable). Add two new optional string fields: location (where the employee worked that day) and work_description (what work the employee did that day). Keep all existing indexes and add appropriate indexes for the new fields if needed."}' | creao-builder-cli database_generate_schema
input.description: Generate updated schema with location and work_description fields

content.text: Great! Now let me verify the generated schema by reading it to ensure the new fields were added correctly.

input.description: Read updated database schema to verify new fields

Perfect! The schema update is complete. Here's a summary of what was accomplished:

**Schema Update Successfully Applied**

The time_card_entry table has been updated with two new optional string fields:

**New Fields Added:**
- **location** (string, nullable) - Where the employee worked that day
- **work_description** (string, nullable) - What work the employee did that day

**Updated Field Count:** 10 â†’ 12 fields

**Generated ORM Files:**
- `/home/user/vite-template/src/sdk/database/orm/orm_time_card_entry.ts` (updated)
- `/home/user/vite-template/src/sdk/database/orm/orm_user.ts` (unchanged)
- `/home/user/vite-template/src/sdk/database/orm/common.ts`
- `/home/user/vite-template/src/sdk/database/orm/client.ts`

All existing fields and indexes have been preserved, and a new index on the location field has been automatically added for query optimization.
